metadata.synopsis: A faith healer (Robert Powell) turns his supernatural powers on a hostile PR man (Broderick Crawford) while treating a senator's (David Hemmings) son.

reviews: "Harlequin" is a curious thriller which at times fails to make its point clear but nevertheless remains remarkably engrossing, primarily because of the very good acting by all persons involved.
Harlequin is a fascinating if flawed psycho thriller that deserves much more attention than it received
This horror film has a high-quality, professional feel but somehow lacks tension or any emotional connection.
Quaintly entertaining little horror chestnut...if you're into old-fashioned Rasputin-lite rehashes and late 70's decor.
